nodes.name: Document To Text
nodes.description: The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature setting for the model (default: 0).

fields.description: Column name for the text content.

fields.title: Image Column
fields.description: Column name for the base 64 image.

fields.title: Mode Selection
fields.description: Select the model to use (text, image, text+image).

fields.name: task
fields.title: Select Prompt
fields.description: Specify the task to perform: summary, translation, topic extraction, or other.

optionsMap.summary: Generate a concise, multi-level bullet-point summary capturing key facts, insights, and implications from the content. Preserve structure and section hierarchy.
optionsMap.translation: Translate the content into fluent, formal English while preserving tone, context, cultural nuances, and domain-specific terminology (e.g., legal, medical, technical).
optionsMap.topic_extraction: Identify and extract key topics, subtopics, and entities. Categorize them with tags (e.g., Person, Location, Concept) and provide brief descriptions or summaries of each.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
You are acting as a Regulatory Document Form Filler AI Assistant. Goal: You must complete a vaccine form for region: ${radio1}.  The form is provided in base64 images You also have a reference regulatory document text from region: ${radio}. Extracted text from the reference document is in content Instructions: 1. Read both the form image and the reference text carefully. 2. Identify all blank or underlined fields in the form. 3. Fill the fields with correct values based on the reference text. 4. If a field does not have an exact match, infer using regulatory equivalence.    - Example: "USA FDA" ≈ "Australia TGA"    - Example: "EU EMA" ≈ "Local Regulatory Authority" 5. Preserve formatting:    - Keep the **HTML structure identical** to the original template.    - Replace only the underlined placeholders with answers.    - Do not add, remove, or modify layout, headers, CSS, or styles. 6. Always ensure the result is **valid standalone HTML**. --- ### Few-Shot Examples **Example 1 (Regulatory Equivalence):** - Input Text Snippet: "The product was authorized by the USA FDA." - Region: Australia - Expected Output Field: "Authorized by Australia TGA" **Example 2 (Filling a Date Field):** - Form Field: "Date of Approval: ________" - Input Text Snippet: "Approval granted on 23 March 2024." - Expected Output Field: "Date of Approval: 23 March 2024" **Example 3 (Preserving HTML Layout):** - Original HTML:           Vaccine Form - ${radio1}            

Vaccine Application Form - ${radio1}

   
      Regulatory Body:       {{FIELD_1}}    
   
      Product Name:       {{FIELD_2}}    
   
      Approval Date:       {{FIELD_3}}    
   
      Authorization Notes:       {{FIELD_4}}    
  --- Output Requirements: - Return **only the filled HTML form**. - Do not include markdown fences (```). - Ensure correctness, completeness, and professional formatting.

fields.name: thinkingBudget
fields.title: Thinking Budget
fields.description: Configure the Gemini thinking budget by specifying the number of tokens to allocate for thinking. For Flash and Flash Lite models, values can range from 0 to 24,576 or -1 for dynamic thinking. For 2.5 Pro model, values must be between 1 and 24,576; setting 0 is not allowed.
